text: (upbeat music)
- Hi, I'm Sounil Yu,
the creator of the Cyber Defense Matrix.
Security is a shared responsibility
between AWS and you, the customer.

While AWS is responsible
for security of the cloud,
it is up to you to ensure

that your keeping everything
that you do on AWS secure.

You are responsible for
security in the cloud.

This is similar to how
we manage our roads.
The government is responsible
for building and maintaining roads,
but it's your responsibility
to make sure you have the right tires
for the weather conditions,
that your vehicle is properly maintained,
and that you drive responsibly.
How you use AWS is similar.
AWS created the infrastructure,
but you need to make sure

that you configure the services
that you use correctly,
that your workloads are properly secured,
and that the applications you write
are free of vulnerabilities.

This means that you
need to remain vigilant
and keep a close eye on alerts,

watch out for potential
security incidents,
and operate within a margin of safety
that allows you to take corrective actions
when events occur.
To help you, AWS offers a marketplace

of tools and resources to help
you move safely and securely
on your cloud journey.

Whether it's securing your
endpoints, applications,
networks, data, or users within AWS,

you will find well-integrated
tools and resources
to help you identify issues,
protect against threats,
detect for intrusions,

and respond and recover from
incidents if they occur.
(upbeat music)
